page_analysis.text_content:
Other excavation considerations

Architectural compatibility & landscape screening
• If a guard rail is required, it must be designed to be architecturally compatible with the residence.
• Additionally, landscape screening may be required by the Planning Dept.

Tree protection
• A tree's root system extends well beyond the drip line and the roots are likely to be within the first 18" below grade.
• It is important to plan excavation in a manner that does not harm tree roots.
• Prior to issuance of building permit, owner to provide evidence that encroaching features or portions of features will not harm trees of any species on subject or abutting lots.
• Consult the city's Tree Technical Manual for other aspects of tree protection during construction.

Fig 37 Excavation, landscape screening, and guard rails

Fig 38 Excavation and tree roots

"When planning a basement, consider the extent of excavation that will be required e.g., some excavation techniques require (for safety reasons) that the excavation to be at a 1:1 slope which may impact tree roots severely."

visual_elements.description: Fig 37 shows a partial side elevation of a building with a basement and excavation area indicated. The figure relates to excavation, landscape screening, and guard rails but the visual details are minimal and mostly show the building's side and excavation area.

Fig 38 shows a side elevation of a building with a basement and excavation area, alongside a large tree with an extensive root system illustrated extending beyond the drip line and below grade. A diagonal line indicates the excavation slope at 1:1 ratio. The figure visually supports the text about tree root protection and excavation impact.

additional_notes: Page number 41 at bottom right corner.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and figures are clear and legible.
cross_references: Consult the city's Tree Technical Manual for other aspects of tree protection during construction.

qualifiers.text: If a guard rail is required, it must be designed to be architecturally compatible with the residence.
Additionally, landscape screening may be required by the Planning Dept.
Prior to issuance of building permit, owner to provide evidence that encroaching features or portions of features will not harm trees of any species on subject or abutting lots.

conditions.text: A tree's root system extends well beyond the drip line and the roots are likely to be within the first 18" below grade.
Excavation to be at a 1:1 slope which may impact tree roots severely.

logical_relationships.expression: If excavation is at a 1:1 slope, then tree roots may be impacted severely.

execution_sequence.action: Determine if a guard rail is required and ensure architectural compatibility.
Assess if landscape screening is required by the Planning Dept.
Plan excavation to avoid harm to tree roots, considering root depth and excavation slope.
Prior to building permit issuance, provide evidence that excavation features will not harm trees on subject or abutting lots.
